intro: Lastrea squamulosa, commonly known as the woolly lastrea, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly covering of white to grayish hairs. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are small, fleshy, and often arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color.
